cyclone.name: TAMMY
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles NNE of Guadeloupe and 50 miles SE of Antigua
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest today, then turning north-northwest Sunday and north on Monday, moving away from the Leeward Islands and into the western Atlantic east of Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the British Virgin Islands (not including St. Croix)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Guadeloupe northward through Antigua, Barbuda, Montserrat, St. Kitts-Nevis, Anguilla, St. Maarten/St. Martin and St. Barthelemy; Tropical Storm Warning for Saba & St. Eustatius
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands from Guadeloupe through Anguilla, with outer tropical-storm-force wind field extending westward toward the U.S. and British Virgin Islands and eastern Puerto Rico
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible but not likely (forecast 1–2 in., isolated 4 in.)
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands may deliver tropical-storm-force gusts; 18 % chance of sustained 34 kt (39 mph) winds; strongest gusts 40–50 mph possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along St. Croix coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain, isolated up to 4 inches could cause brief urban/low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells producing hazardous surf and rip currents on east- and north-facing beaches
